dict.string: Braden took 50 playing cards and arranged them in 5 even piles. How many playing cards did Braden put in each pile?
The Bloomington bakery had 930 bags of sugar. Then an employee used 250 bags of sugar to make some cheesecake. How much sugar is left?
Before the recent housing boom, there were 682 houses in Hamilton County. Now, there are 943 houses. How many houses did developers build during the housing boom?
There are 75 people attending a conference. If each table at the conference can seat 7 people, how many tables will the conference need?
Mr. Chapman built a cabin with 215 logs, and his friend built a cabin with 189 logs. How many logs did the two of them use?

Jodie was collecting coins. She got 5 coins from her piggy bank and 6 coins from her brother. Her father gave Jodie 12 coins. Jodie gave 6 of the coins to her friend Tara. How many coins did Jodie have left?
Shawna saved $41 in March. She saved $25 in April and $48 in May. Then Shawna spent $40 on a keyboard. How much money does Shawna have left?
62 students went for boating ride. A boat must have 4 people. Students are told to form groups of 4. How many students would be left outside any of the groups?
Anne saved $48 in June, $36 in July, and $16 in August. Then Anne spent $20 on school supplies and $67 on new clothes. How much money does Anne have left?
Connor saved up $47. Then he got $27 for his allowance. Connor spent $10 on a pair of gloves, $4 on a winter hat, $42 on a jacket, and $18 on books. How much money does Connor have left?
